title: The cult-favorite Squatty Potty is at its lowest price ever
text:
The cult-favorite Squatty Potty is at its lowest price ever

This legendary toilet stool is on sale for its lowest price ever. (Photo: Squatty Potty)

— Our editors review and recommend products to help you buy the stuff you need. If you make a purchase by clicking one of our links, we may earn a small share of the revenue. However, our picks and opinions are independent from USA Today’s newsroom and any business incentives.

Chances are, you've heard of the Squatty Potty before. This much-buzzed-about toilet stool, which was featured on Shark Tank in 2014, claims that it can completely change the way you go about your backdoor business, making it easier and more relaxing to, well, you know, take a poop. And right now, you can get this cult-favorite product on sale on Amazon for its lowest price ever.

How effective is the Squatty Potty? It might seem like a novelty product—a stool that helps you poop better, how is that even a thing? But plenty of reviewers, including our very own Camryn Rabideau, claim that it actually does work as advertised.

More: 15 things you shouldn't wait until Black Friday to buy

The stool is designed to help relax your Puborectalis muscle, which maintains a tight grip around your you-know-what to keep poop in check throughout your daily goings-on. When its time pop a squat, the muscle should ease its grip, but if you're just in a standard sitting position, you're more prone to straining, hemorrhoids and other unpleasantness.

Since doctors and other experts actually maintain that the best way to eliminate is with your feet propped up, Squatty Potty is the perfect solution to a problem you might never have realized was screwing you up. It usually retails for around $24.99 and almost never drops in price, but it's currently on sale on Amazon for just under $18, which is the cheapest it's ever been. Reviewers say this stool really is a game-changer—in fact, the biggest problem about the Squatty Potty is that it'll ruin you for ordinary toilet experiences.
